comments.content:
It looks kinda like a modified Futura Black SB:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/futura-black-sb/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415225153/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/futura-black-sb/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/futura-black-sb/regular/")

We had a discussion here recently about the font used for GO trains but I can't seem to find it on the search....

edit: found it [http://typophile.com/node/31513](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415225153/http:/typophile.com/node/31513 "http://typophile.com/node/31513")
Heh it doesn't look like those fonts. I also think that is something like futura just modified futura.

I seem to remember this one being called Traffic, but I can't find it anywhere.

- Lex
I expected to find it in Rookledge's, but it's not in there.
I think you're right Lex, Letraset's Traffic. Also available as Trafalgar & Trufflette on the net somewhere.

Just checked my old Letraset book - it is Traffic. I swear I used to have a digital version, which means it probably came bundled with Corel Draw 8.

- Lex

Btw what type french used when the plate was black colored: [http://www.cddc-software.com/supercars/205t16/Image11.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415225153/http:/www.cddc-software.com/supercars/205t16/Image11.jpg "http://www.cddc-software.com/supercars/205t16/Image11.jpg")?  
 [http://www.elgefa.de/r4/r4l.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415225153/http:/www.elgefa.de/r4/r4l.jpg "http://www.elgefa.de/r4/r4l.jpg")  
 [http://r5turbo.free.fr/ARTICLES/netb%20INS.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415225153/http:/r5turbo.free.fr/ARTICLES/netb%20INS.jpg "http://r5turbo.free.fr/ARTICLES/netb%20INS.jpg")

Thanks

Still looks like traffic. The plate itself looks like Agency or something similar.

- Lex
Maybe lineto numberplate france but maybe they just look a like...
